For any set $X\subset\W$, let $\mathbf{1}_X$ be the function which maps every item in $\W$ to a number in the set
$\{0, 1\}$ as follows:
    
$$
    \mathbf{1}_X(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll}
        1 & \textrm{if } x\in X     \\
        0 & \textrm{if } x\not\in X
    \end{array}\right.
$$

Let $X$ and $Y$ be any two subsets of $\W$. Express the functions
$\mathbf{1}_{X\cap Y}$, $\mathbf{1}_{X\cup Y}$, and $\mathbf{1}_{X-Y}$ in
terms of $\mathbf{1}_X$ and $\mathbf{1}_Y$.
